newsitem.title: USA: Lincoln looks for American States buyer - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Lincoln looks for American States buyer - WSJ.

text.p: Lincoln National Corp is considering selling its property casualty business American States Financial Corp and Goldman, Sachs & Co has sought potential buyers, the Wall Street Journal said.

Goldman investment bankers had "sounded out" acquirers in recent weeks and a number of property casualty companies were thought to be interested, the paper said in Wednesday's electronic edition, citing people familiar with the matter.
American States shares have risen on speculation it might be up for sale.

Lincoln National, which owns an 83 percent stake in American States, recently declined to comment on such talk but told Reuters on March 7: "All options are open. We look at opportunities as they come and we don't preclude anything."
